notesStmt.note: All folios partially water-damaged and/or mutilated. Several lacunae. Water-damaged. Several folios are mutilated.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A Judeo-Arabic commentary of Japhet ben Ali on Genesis 1 and Genesis 18.

supportDesc.extent:
103 folios (+ 2 paper flyleaves at the beginning and at the end). 9 folios
94 folios

collation.p:
A singe quire, wanting last folio.
Singed with Hebrew letters and Arabic word on the upper margin of the first page.
5 quires (out of original 28, folios 10-48) of 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic words on the upper margin of the first page and on the lower margin of the last page.
9 quires (folios 49-103) of originally 10 leaves each, signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic words on the upper margin of the first page and on the lower margin of the last, but only the 5th and 7th quires are fully preserved.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive of 16th to 17th century. Oriental square and semi-cursive script of 16th to 17th century, partially punctuated.

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882, folio [104v].
